reviews.author: Shilo (Mae)
reviews.review: Lots of things needed maintainence when we moved in. Balcony is lovely, stains on the carpet not so much... it's very old and some of the walls were dirty in our room. Lights flickers when you turn them on as well. It's not horrible but it's not amazing either.

reviews.author: Andy nguyen
reviews.review: Had mice come in my dorm in stack 3, however the schools exterminator quickly solved this problem. Other dorms seem to be more run down with old carpet and loose kitchen cabinets. Not to bad for first apartment style housing though.

reviews.author: Crystal Schmalz
reviews.review: This is campus housing for WWU. It is all 2bdrm apartments, that are set up to housing 4 students (2 per room). It works out to being about $350 a month & you don't need a meal plan!! It has a full dinningroom & kitchen with a gas stove,

reviews.author: Elizabeth
reviews.review: These apartments are great when it comes to the price but currently there is limited parking due to construction. If you're looking for an affordable option as a student at Western Washington University I suggest it.

reviews.author: Shara Rhoads
reviews.review: For campus housing, they're okay. It takes several requests before maintenance addresses a problem. My daughter's heat was stuck on high; turning it down or even off did not help. Once they did attempt to fix it, now that temperatures outside are getting colder, the heat won't turn on.

reviews.author: Quentin Jensen
reviews.review: best dorm, cheaper and is an actual apartment. facilities aren't mind blowing, but functional and well maintained. lots of community events

reviews.author: Conrad Norris
reviews.review: Its cheaply built, but its got a bit a charm and is priced competitively with other places in Bellingham and its close to campus

reviews.author: Debra Haraldson
reviews.review: It's for college students.  They do however need to give our younger generation a break in costs for everything while they are students.

reviews.author: Austin Voecks
reviews.review: A nice, cost effective option if you want to stay close to campus

reviews.author: Jack Montgomery
reviews.review: Acceptable but dated living space. It's what you make it!

reviews.author: Kianna Keck
reviews.review: I never lived here so I wouldn't know.

reviews.author: M. W.
reviews.review: You get what you give: cheap, but that's about it
